title: section 13 of the Childcare Support Act 2018 (No. 11 of 2018), and with the
heading: 5. Schedule 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
5. Schedule 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of the following schedule for schedule 3. 

‚ÄúSCHEDULE 1 

Amounts per hour of non-income related financial support 

Non-income related financial support shall be calculated at the following rate: 

‚Ç¨1.40 per hour in the case of a child who is older than 24 weeks of age 
and under 15 years of age.‚Äù 

‚ÄúSCHEDULE 3 

Methodology in accordance with which the amount per hour (if any) of 
income-related financial support shall be calculated 

(a) 

The base income threshold shall be ‚Ç¨26,000. 

A minimum amount of income-related financial support at the rate of 

(b) 
‚Ç¨1.40 applies to a child aged between 24 weeks and under 15 years of age. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
‚ÄúIris Oifigi√∫il‚Äù of 27th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [701] 3 

(c) 
If an applicant qualifies for income-related financial support, the 
scheme administrator shall determine the amount per hour of income-related 
financial support as follows: 

where an applicant‚Äôs reckonable income is below or equal to the 

(i) 
base income threshold, the maximum amount per hour will apply; 

where an applicant‚Äôs reckonable income is at or exceeds the 

(ii) 
income limit, the amount per hour shall be zero; 

(iii) where an applicant‚Äôs reckonable income is between the base 
income threshold and the income limit, the amount per hour shall be 
determined by the following formula:

(ùëãùëÜ ‚àí ùëÅùëÜ)(ùëÄùëá ‚àí ùëÖùêº)
(ùëÄùëá ‚àí ùêµùëá)

) 

where‚Äì 

NS is the minimum amount of financial support per hour, 

XS is the maximum amount of financial support per hour, 

MT is the income limit, 

BT is the base income threshold, and 

RI is the reckonable income. 

(d) 
In determining the amount per hour, if any, of income-related financial 
support, a Multiple Child Discount shall be applied to net income by the 
scheme administrator in relation to children under the age of 15 years - 

(1) 

(2) 

who reside with the applicant or with his or her partner, and 

where the applicant or his or her partner is a parent of the child. 

The discount which shall be applied to net income to determine the amount per 
hour of income related financial support shall be: 

(i) 

(ii) 

‚Ç¨4,300 in relation to two children; 

‚Ç¨8,600 in relation to more than two children.‚Äù

foregoing Regulations.

title: section 13 of the Childcare Support Act 2018 (No. 11 of 2018), and with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are made pursuant to powers conferred on the Minister for 
Children and Youth Affairs under section 13 of the Childcare Support Act 
2018 with the consent of the Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

These Regulations amend the Regulations previously made under section 13 of 
the Childcare Support Act 2018 (S.I. 378/2019), and (S.I. No. 367/2022) to 
increase the hourly minimum award from ‚Ç¨0.50 to ‚Ç¨1.40.
